text.0: drink indra of the savoury juice and cheer thee with our milky draught.
text.1: be for our weal our friend and sharer of the feast and let thy wisdom guard us well.
text.2: in thy kind grace and favour may we still be strong expose us not to foes attack.
text.3: with manifold assistance guard and succour us and bring us to felicity.
text.4: may these my songs of praise exalt thee lord who hast abundant wealth.
text.5: men skilled in holy hymns pure with the hues of fire have sung them with their lauds to thee.
text.6: he with his might enhanced by Ṛṣis thousandfold hath like an ocean spread himself.
text.7: his majesty is praised as true at solemn rites his power where holy singers rule.
text.8: indra for worship of the gods indra while sacrifice proceeds.
text.9: indra as worshippers in battleshock we call indra that we may win the spoil.
text.10: with might hath indra spread out heaven and earth with power hath indra lighted up the sun.
text.11: in indra are all creatures closely held in him meet the distilling somadrops.
text.12: men with their lauds are urging thee indra to drink the soma first.
text.13: the Ṛbhus in accord have lifted up their voice and rudras sung thee as the first.
text.14: indra increased his manly strength at sacrifice in the wild rapture of this juice.
text.15: and living men today even as of old sing forth their praises to his majesty.
text.16: i crave of thee that hero strength that thou mayst first regard this prayer.
text.17: wherewith thou holpest bhṛgu and the yatis and praskaṇva when the prize was staked.
text.18: wherewith thou sentest mighty waters to the sea that indra is thy manly strength.
text.19: for ever unattainable is this power of him to whom the worlds have cried aloud.
text.20: help us o indra when we pray to thee for wealth and hero might.
text.21: first help thou on to strength the man who strives to win and aid our laud o ancient one.
text.22: help for us indra as thou holpest paura once this mans devotions bent on gain.
text.23: help as thou gavest ruśama and Śyāvaka and svarṇara and kṛpa aid.
text.24: what newest of imploring prayers shall then the zealous mortal sing.
text.25: for have not they who laud his might and indrapower won for themselves the light of heaven.
text.26: when shall they keep the law and praise thee mid the gods who counts as Ṛṣi and as sage.
text.27: when ever wilt thou indra maghavan come nigh to pressers or to praisers call.
text.28: these songs of ours exceeding sweet these hymns of praise ascend to thee.
text.29: like everconquering chariots that display their strength gain wealth and give unfailing aid.
text.30: the bhṛgus are like suns like kaṇvas and have gained all that their thoughts were bent upon.
text.31: the living men of priyamedhas race have sung exalting indra with their lauds.
text.32: best slayer of the vṛtras yoke thy bay steeds indra from afar.
text.33: come with the high ones hither maghavan to us mighty to drink the soma juice.
text.34: for these the bards and singers have cried out to thee with prayer to gain the sacrifice.
text.35: as such o maghavan indra who lovest song even as a lover bear my call.
text.36: thou from the lofty plains above o indra hurledst vṛtra down.
text.37: thou dravest forth the kine of guileful mṛgaya and arbuda from the mountains hold.
text.38: bright were the flaming fires the sun gave forth his shine and soma indras juice shone clear.
text.39: indra thou blewest the great dragon from the air men must regard that valorous deed.
text.40: the fairest courser of them all who runneth on as twere to heaven.
text.41: which indra and the maruts gave and pākasthāman kaurayāṇ.
text.42: to me hath pākasthāman given a ruddy horse good at the pole.
text.43: filling is girth and rousing wealth.
text.44: compared with whom no other ten strong coursers harnessed to the pole.
text.45: bear tugrya to his dwelling place.
text.46: raiment is body food is life and healing ointment giveth strength.
text.47: as the freehanded giver of the ruddy steed i have named pākasthāman fourth.
